intro: Lessingia filaginifolia, commonly known as the filagratelessia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Lessingia filaginifolia is often found in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats.
